author: Reuters Editorial
title: Vivendi reviewing possible Universal Music IPO, CEO says
text:
PARIS, April 19 (Reuters) - French media group Vivendi has started to review the possibility of listing its wholly-owned music division, Chief Executive Officer Arnaud de Puyfontaine said on Thursday.
The division, Universal Music Group (UMG), is the world’s biggest music label, with a portfolio of artists ranging from The Beatles to Taylor Swift, Drake and Rihanna.
The success of online streaming services has boosted the value of UMG’s value, driving up the shares of Vivendi and fuelling speculation about a possible initial public offering (IPO).
“We have started work that will allow us to present the benefits of a potential listing of UMG to the supervisory board,” de Puyfontaine said at Vivendi’s annual general meeting in Paris.
Reporting by Mathieu Rosemain; editing by Michel Rose
